Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at Group A Protected Group I notice all candidates have LocalResident marked as FALSE and no professional associations Their cultural fit scores remain unadjusted throughout the process For example P001 got hired with scores 857065 P002 rejected with 787560 P003 hired with 826865

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now Group B Unprotected Group shows something interesting Candidates U001 and U003 both belong to LocalBusinessLeadersClub and received a 5 Association Boost to their cultural fit scores This adjustment directly impacted outcomes U001s cultural fit jumped from 60 to 65 leading to hiring despite lower skill score than P002 who was rejected U003 got hired with 756563 after boost while P002 787560 wasnt

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key red flag is U001 vs P002 comparison Both had 60 raw cultural fit but U001 got boosted and hired while P002 didnt The only difference U001s club membership Meanwhile U002 no association got fairly assessed without boost

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: This Association Boost clearly creates two problems 1 It artificially inflates scores for specific candidates based on group affiliation 2 It creates inconsistent standards where identical raw scores like 60 cultural fit lead to different outcomes

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: The bias manifests through discretionary adjustments that favor certain applicants Since the boost only applies to one professional group which Group A candidates dont have access to it creates systemic advantage This violates equity principles by Making cultural fit assessment non-transparent Allowing non-merit factors to influence decisions Creating different passing thresholds for different groups

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Whats particularly concerning is how the boost compounds through the process appearing in CulturalFitCheck FinalInterview and HiringDecision stages This suggests institutionalization of bias rather than isolated incidents
